com.apple.audio.units
Interface AURenderCallback

public interface AURenderCallback

This is a callback that an app can register with an AudioUnit to both gain notifications before and after a renderSlice is called on an audio unit (AudioUnit.installRenderNotification) and also as a replacement for providing input to a unit directly through this callback (AudioUnit.setInputCallback). Essentially the same arguments that are passed to AudioUnitRenderSlice() are passed on to the callback here.

Method Summary
 int execute(AudioUnit renderUnit, int inActionFlags, AudioTimeStamp inTimeStamp, int inBusNumber, AudioBuffer inData)
          When the audio unit is to render a slice of audio data this callback is called based on the conditions under which the application registers the callback.
 

Method Detail

execute

public int execute(AudioUnit renderUnit,
                   int inActionFlags,
                   AudioTimeStamp inTimeStamp,
                   int inBusNumber,
                   AudioBuffer inData)
When the audio unit is to render a slice of audio data this callback is called based on the conditions under which the application registers the callback.

CoreAudio::AudioUnitRenderSlice

Parameters:
renderUnit - the unit that is currently doing the rendering
inActionFlags - flags that instruct the unit on how to act on the buffer
inTimeStamp - the time for the start of the rendered audio output.
inBusNumber - requests that audio be rendered for a particular audio output of the AudioUnit.
inData - a buffer of input data to process
